title: 114_hr1523
content: The "Community Bank Access to Capital Act of 2015" changes the asset threshold for small bank holding companies from less than $1,000,000,000 to less than $5,000,000,000 and amends the Dodd-Frank Act to reflect this adjustment. Additionally, the Act provides an exemption for community banks from Basel III regulations. The "Community Bank Access to Capital Act of 2015" exempts community banks with assets of $50,000,000,000 or less from Basel III regulations. The Comptroller of the Currency, the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, and the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation will adjust capital requirements accordingly. SEC. 4 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 is amended to exempt insured depository institutions or depository institution holding companies with less than $1,000,000,000 in consolidated assets from internal control attestation requirements. SEC. 5. REGULATION D CHANGES. The Securities and Exchange Commission may not adjust the net worth, income thresholds, and shall revise the limitation on the number of purchasers from 35 to 70 within 3 months. SEC. 6. SHAREHOLDER THRESHOLD TREATMENT OF SAVINGS AND LOAN HOLDING COMPANIES. Amendments to Section 12 and Section 15 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 include changes related to bank holding companies and savings and loan holding companies. Amendments to the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 include changes related to bank holding companies and savings and loan holding companies, with definitions provided for both terms. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 includes definitions for bank holding companies and savings and loan holding companies.
